data.title: Movies and TV Shows
data.meta_description: Adam Devine's filmography, sorted by online popularity. Learn more about the television and films they've appeared in.
data.text:
Community

as Willy • 1 episode • # 97 most popular show

Community is a comedy television series that follows a quirky group of students at Greendale Community College. The show revolves around their misadventures and unique experiences as they navigate through classes and various campus activities. Filled with witty dialogue and pop culture references, Community explores the dynamics of the study group and their interactions with eccentric faculty members. The series skillfully blends comedy and satire, touching on relatable themes such as friendship, identity, and personal growth. With its clever writing and talented ensemble cast, Community offers a fresh and entertaining take on the college experience.

Modern Family

as Andy Bailey • 22 episode s • # 129 most popular show

Modern Family is a critically acclaimed sitcom that follows the lives of Jay Pritchett and his family in suburban Los Angeles. The series takes a humorous and often heartwarming look at the everyday challenges and triumphs faced by three diverse households. Through a mockumentary style, the show explores the ups and downs of Jay's traditional family, his daughter's mixed marriage, and his son's unconventional household. With its relatable characters and witty writing, Modern Family offers a fresh and entertaining perspective on modern-day family dynamics.

American Dad!

as Christoff (voice) • 1 episode • # 140 most popular show

American Dad! is an animated sitcom that follows the daily life of Stan Smith, a staunchly conservative CIA agent, as he navigates his personal and professional life in the fictional town of Langley Falls, Virginia. Alongside his quirky family, including his wife Francine, alien Roger, and talking fish Klaus, Stan embarks on a series of comedic adventures and misadventures that often satirize American politics, pop culture, and societal issues. The show combines political satire, absurdist humor, and family dynamics to provide a unique and entertaining portrayal of suburban life in America.

American Dad!

as Karate Tournament Announcer (voice) • 1 episode • # 140 most popular show

American Dad! is an animated sitcom that follows the daily life of Stan Smith, a staunchly conservative CIA agent, as he navigates his personal and professional life in the fictional town of Langley Falls, Virginia. Alongside his quirky family, including his wife Francine, alien Roger, and talking fish Klaus, Stan embarks on a series of comedic adventures and misadventures that often satirize American politics, pop culture, and societal issues. The show combines political satire, absurdist humor, and family dynamics to provide a unique and entertaining portrayal of suburban life in America.

The Righteous Gemstones

as Kelvin Gemstone • 27 episode s • # 287 most popular show

The Righteous Gemstones is a comedy series that follows the lives of the Gemstone family, a wealthy televangelist dynasty. Led by patriarch Eli Gemstone, the family runs a successful megachurch empire, using their influence to amass vast wealth and power. As they navigate the challenges of maintaining their public image and dealing with internal family dynamics, they also find themselves entangled in a variety of scandals. Filled with dark humor and witty satire, The Righteous Gemstones offers a satirical take on religion, greed, and the contradictions of modern-day faith.

Hell's Kitchen

as Self - Restaurant Patron • 1 episode • # 295 most popular show

Hell's Kitchen is a reality cooking competition television series that follows a group of aspiring chefs as they compete for the chance to win a head chef position at a prestigious restaurant. Hosted by renowned chef Gordon Ramsay, the show features intense culinary challenges, where chefs are pushed to their limits, working under extreme pressure to create delicious dishes within tight time constraints. With its high-stakes competitions and dramatic moments in the kitchen, Hell's Kitchen has become a popular show among food enthusiasts and reality TV fans alike.

Arrested Development

1 episode • # 362 most popular show

Arrested Development is a comedic television series that follows the lives of the dysfunctional Bluth family. The show revolves around Michael Bluth, who tries to maintain some semblance of order while dealing with his eccentric relatives. With its clever writing and quirky characters, Arrested Development is known for its unique blend of humor and satire. The show garnered critical acclaim for its intricate plotlines and layered storytelling, making it a cult favorite among fans. Featuring a talented ensemble cast, Arrested Development seamlessly combines absurd situations with sharp wit, creating a truly entertaining viewing experience.

The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon

as Self • 2 episode s • # 460 most popular show

The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon is a popular American late-night talk show, with Fallon at the helm since February 17, 2014. The New York-based program features a mix of comedy sketches, celebrity interviews, and live musical performances, upholding the legacy of the historic Tonight Show franchise on NBC.

Steven Universe

as Pizza Steve (voice) • 1 episode • # 489 most popular show

Steven Universe is an animated television show created by Rebecca Sugar. The series follows the adventures of Steven, a young boy who lives with a group of magical beings known as the Crystal Gems. Together, they protect the world from threats and discover the secrets of the Gem race. With its engaging characters, unique art style, and progressive themes, Steven Universe has gained a dedicated fanbase and critical acclaim. The show explores topics such as identity, love, and acceptance, while incorporating catchy musical numbers and heartfelt storytelling.

Workaholics

as Adam DeMamp • 86 episode s • # 1,087 most popular show

Workaholics is a comedy television series that follows the lives of three college dropout friends who work together as telemarketers. Set in a fictional call center, the show highlights the hilarious and often absurd situations the trio find themselves in as they navigate through the challenges of adulthood. With a perfect blend of workplace humor and everyday life experiences, Workaholics offers a relatable and light-hearted portrayal of young professionals trying to balance their careers and personal lives.

Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen

as Self - Guest • 1 episode • # 1,133 most popular show

Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen is a late-night talk show that delves into pop culture with a particular focus on reality television. The show features interviews with celebrities and personalities from various Bravo reality series, fostering a casual and interactive atmosphere where guests participate in games and answer viewer questions.

Drunk History

as Pavel Belyayev • 1 episode • # 1,277 most popular show

Drunk History is a comedy television show that combines historical reenactments with intoxicated storytellers. Each episode features a different narrator who recounts a real historical event while under the influence. Actors then lip sync the dialogue, acting out the drunken narrations. The show, known for its humorous and often absurd retellings of famous moments in history, has gained a cult following and critical acclaim. With a unique and entertaining format, Drunk History offers viewers a lighthearted and comedic approach to learning about the past.

The Late Late Show with James Corden

as Self • 1 episode • # 1,557 most popular show

The Late Late Show with James Corden is a late-night talk show hosted by James Corden. The show features celebrity interviews, musical performances, and comedy sketches. It has gained popularity for its unique segments such as Carpool Karaoke and Crosswalk the Musical. With Corden's charm and wit, the show provides a humorous and entertaining late-night experience for viewers.

Pitch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin

as Bumper Allen • 6 episode s • # 1,581 most popular show

Pitch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin is a television show that follows the musical journey of Bumper, a talented young singer from Berlin. Each episode showcases Bumper's participation in various singing competitions and his struggles to make it big in the music industry. Viewers are treated to a captivating blend of drama, laughter, and musical performances as Bumper navigates the challenges of fame, competition, and personal relationships. With its catchy soundtrack and charismatic cast, Pitch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin is a must-watch for music lovers and fans of engaging storytelling.

Comedy Bang! Bang!

as Nick • 1 episode • # 1,758 most popular show

Comedy Bang! Bang! is a comedic television show based on Scott Aukerman's popular podcast of the same name. The show cleverly combines the format of a late night talk show with surreal elements. Each episode features Aukerman engaging celebrity guests in unfiltered and improvisational conversations, spiced up with banter and beats from bandleader Reggie Watts. This reinvents the traditional celebrity interview and adds a unique touch to the show. Packed with character cameos, filmic shorts, sketches, and games, Comedy Bang! Bang! provides thirty minutes of absurd and laugh-filled entertainment with some of the biggest names in comedy.

A Little Late with Lilly Singh

as Self • 1 episode • # 2,003 most popular show

A Little Late with Lilly Singh is a late-night talk show hosted by comedian and YouTuber Lilly Singh. The show features interviews, sketches, and musical performances, with a focus on diverse and unique voices. With her energetic and humorous style, Singh brings a fresh perspective to the late-night landscape, tackling a wide range of topics including current events, pop culture, and social issues. A Little Late with Lilly Singh has quickly gained a loyal following for its witty and entertaining approach to late-night television.

Snake Oil

as Celebrity Guest Advisor • 2 episode s • # 2,113 most popular show

Snake Oil is a television game show where contestants evaluate a series of unique products pitched by various entrepreneurs. During the show, participants must discern which products are genuine business ventures and which ones are fictitious, coined as 'Snake Oil'. The participants are guided by celebrity advisors and face the challenge of investing an initial sum from their 'bank' to potentially win a larger prize, all while navigating the risk of deception.

The Joel McHale Show with Joel McHale

as Self - Special Guest • 1 episode • # 2,220 most popular show

The Joel McHale Show with Joel McHale is a weekly comedy commentary program that dissects trending news, pop culture, and online content. Hosted by actor and comedian Joel McHale, the show features a blend of humor-laced critique through celebrity interviews, sketches, and video clips covering various topics from television, sports, and politics, to celebrity gossip and internet phenomena.

Pitch Perfect

as Bumper • # 857 most popular movie

Pitch Perfect is a 2012 American musical comedy film about a college student named Beca who reluctantly joins an all-girl a cappella group at her new school. The film follows their journey as they compete in music competitions, challenging traditional arrangements with innovative harmonic combinations.

Pitch Perfect 2

as Bumper • # 858 most popular movie

Pitch Perfect 2 is a 2015 American musical comedy film and the sequel to the popular 2012 movie, Pitch Perfect. Directed by Elizabeth Banks and written by Kay Cannon, the film follows the journey of the Bellas, an all-girl a cappella group, as they compete in an international competition. After being removed from the Aca-Circuit, the Bellas are determined to clear their name and prove themselves by winning the prestigious competition. Along the way, they must strengthen their bonds of friendship and face new challenges. With a talented cast and catchy musical performances, Pitch Perfect 2 is a delightful and entertaining sequel.

The Lego Batman Movie

as The Flash / Barry Allen (voice) • # 1,714 most popular movie

The Lego Batman Movie is a 2017 animated superhero comedy film that follows a cooler-than-ever Bruce Wayne, who must deal with the usual suspects planning to rule Gotham City. In the process, he accidentally adopts a teenage orphan who wishes to become his sidekick. Directed by Chris McKay, the film features a collaboration between production houses from the United States, Australia, and Denmark. It is a spin-off in The Lego Movie franchise and the second installment overall. The cast includes Will Arnett reprising his role as Batman, alongside Zach Galifianakis, Michael Cera, Rosario Dawson, and Ralph Fiennes.

Ice Age: Collision Course

as Julian (voice) • # 1,825 most popular movie

Ice Age: Collision Course is a 2016 American animated adventure comedy film that serves as the fifth installment in the Ice Age film series. Directed by Michael Thurmeier and co-directed by Galen T. Chu, the movie follows the beloved characters Manny, Sid, Diego, and the rest of the herd as they embark on a thrilling quest to save the planet. When Scrat's pursuit of his precious acorn takes him outside of Earth, he sets off a series of cosmic events that put the world in peril. Filled with laughter, adventure, and new exotic locations, this film promises to entertain audiences of all ages.

The Out-Laws

as Owen Browning • # 2,328 most popular movie

The Out-Laws is a gripping crime thriller that revolves around the lives of five sisters who form an unconventional alliance to seek justice. Set in a small town, the film explores themes of family loyalty, revenge, and female empowerment. With its intense storyline and well-developed characters, The Out-Laws takes the audience on a thrilling and suspenseful journey. Directed by an acclaimed filmmaker, the movie captivates viewers with its intricate plot twists and thought-provoking themes.
